item.title: All Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 Dark Ops Challenges, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Black Ops 7 has plenty to dig your teeth into, and long-term Call of Duty fans will know all about the Dark Ops challenges that lie ready to be completed across various game modes—and we’ve got the full list.

Dark Ops Challenges in Call of Duty titles award exclusive calling cards with mysterious objectives to complete that, unlike other challenges, do not show the necessary task to tick off.

We’re here to make your life a lot easier, however, as we’ve got the full list of Dark Ops Challenges across the Campaign, Multiplayer, and Zombies.

All Black Ops 7 Dark Ops Challenges

There are 22 Dark Ops challenges available in Black Ops 7 right now, with an additional two that were only available in the beta and are now unobtainable.

We’ve split all the challenges into their respective game modes below.

All Black Ops 7 Campaign Dark Ops Challenges

All Black Ops 7 Multiplayer Dark Ops Challenges

All Black Ops 7 Zombies Dark Ops Challenges

Have you completed any of these hidden challenges in Black Ops 7 yet? Let us know in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Black Ops 7, find out details of the upcoming Battle Pass, and learn how to Weapon Prestige in the game.

item.title: Among Us Collaboration Announced with Stardew Valley
item.content:encoded:
The Among Us x Stardew Valley collaboration is live now and will run till February 18, 2026; interested players can grab a free Stardew Cosmicube.

Among Us has been getting a few interesting game collaborations lately, with new cosmetics coming to the game. We saw the title collaborate with Genshin Impact in September to celebrate the launch of Version Luna I. Now, a new collaboration with Stardew Valley has arrived, bringing a whole range of new items to the game.

Among Us’ Stardew Cosmicube is Free For All Players

Announced through a blog post by Innersloth, the Among Us x Stardew Valley collaboration will be available for a limited time, where players will be able to grab a free Stardew Cosmicube. For those unaware, Cosmicubes are special items that can provide players with themed cosmetics through a branching patch; you can learn how to claim them here. Check out all the items that will be available through the Stardew Cosmicube in Among Us below:

  • Junimo Pet
  • Krobus Pet
  • Abigail’s Outfit Skin
  • Abigail’s Locks Hat
  • Dance of the Moonlight Jellies Nameplate
  • Day’s End Nameplate
  • Feathery Friend – Blue Hat
  • Feathery Friend – Void Hat
  • Feathery Friend – White Hat
  • Grandpa’s Beard Visor
  • Grandpa’s Nightcap Hat
  • It’s a New Day Nameplate
  • Looking For These? Skin
  • Lewis’s Overalls Skin
  • Lewis’s Moustache Visor
  • Lewis’s Cap Hat
  • Linus’s Hair Hat
  • Linus’s Beard Visor
  • Linus’s Leaves Skin
  • Prized Straw Hat
  • Mr. Qi’s Suit Skin
  • Mr. Qi’s Shades Visor
  • Mr. Qi’s Hat
  • Sebastian’s Bangs Hat
  • Sebastian’s Hoodie Skin
  • Spring’s Parsnip Hat
  • Summer’s Melon Hat
  • Void Egg Hat
  • Work Overalls Skin

In other news, Stardew Valley smashed a Steam record held by Portal 2 for 14 years. Additionally, Balatro announced collaborations with The Witcher 3, Among Us, and other games earlier this year. What are your thoughts on the Among Us x Stardew Valley collaboration? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Roblox adding a new ‘age estimation’ feature, which has players concerned. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Levi Retires from League Esports and Pivots to Content Creation
item.content:encoded:
In a recent video uploaded to YouTube, iconic Vietnamese League of Legends pro player, Đỗ “Levi” Duy Khánh, announced his official retirement from active competition. He cited wanting to spend more time on himself and start a family, and suggested he can’t do that while he continues to compete professionally.

Instead, Levi will step away and focus on content creation and streaming, continuing to contribute to the League of Legends scene by broadcasting content to the hundreds of thousands of followers he has amassed over the years.

Levi has been competing in the League of Legends space more or less since the game’s esports scene blew up. He’s been a solid player since 2013, and in his recent farewell video, Levi explained that League was ‘the answer’ to what he wanted to do with his life.

He would go on to become known as one of the most effective junglers in League of Legends.

In his video, Levi said:

I hope that, in the future, I’ll be happier, smile more, and continue to be with you all. It’s time to say goodbye to the professional League of Legends Levi and welcome the beginning of the streamer.

In the Pacific region, especially, Levi is something of a legend, and he’s arguably the best player to ever emerge from Vietnam.

Here’s Levi’s full farewell video:

Like many other retired esports competitors, Levi will now turn his attention to content creation:

I love streaming. Even while I was competing, I spent a lot of my free time streaming and interacting with everyone. I love making people laugh. I’ll still play League of Legends and watch official matches.

Do you have any fond recollections of Levi? Let me know what you’ve seen on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that fans think OpTic Texas will three-peat

item.title: Roblox Adding New ‘Age Estimation’ Feature That Has Users Concerned
item.content:encoded:
Roblox is taking another step into the realm of child safety by setting up an age estimation feature that must be used before users can chat to anyone within the ecosystem, it has been revealed. From December, users worldwide will be forced to complete an age estimation process if they want to use Roblox to message any other player, but not everyone is pleased.

This is because the age estimation is being achieved via an AI-supported platform called Persona. Users will need to upload a picture of themselves, which is then analyzed by AI, and subsequently placed into an ‘age group’ that remains inherently restricted.

Good, Not Great

The Roblox Corporation has been closely scrutinized over the last year or so, with several significant lawsuits being filed against the company because it does not do enough to protect children using the platform. It has been claimed numerous times that Roblox is a breeding ground for predators, and even Chris Hansen came out to make a damning documentary against the ecosystem.

The latest ‘safety standard’ will see Roblox introduce an age estimation process that will start being deployed as early as next month.

From a recent release:

We’re unlocking chat and age-appropriate experiences for our users by requiring them to complete an age check through Facial Age Estimation or ID verification1. Once the age check is complete, users will only be allowed to chat with others in similar age groups, unless they become Trusted Connections with people they know. 

It begins in regions like Australia, New Zealand, and the Netherlands, but by January, the rest of the world will be pulled into the optional age estimation check. If you want to chat on Roblox, you must verify your ‘age group’.

The Roblox Corporation explained how this will work:

As part of our ongoing consultations with child development experts, we’ve defined common-sense limits on who can chat together on Roblox. After users complete the age check process, we will inform them of their assigned age group: Under 9, 9-12, 13-15, 16-17, 18-20, or 21+. Users will be able to chat with those in their own age group and similar age groups, as appropriate.

For example: 

  • Elisa (estimated age 12): Elisa has access to chat with users aged 15 or younger in Experience chat. All users 16 or older are prevented from initiating or engaging in chat with her.
  • Marcus (estimated age 18): Marcus has access to chat with users aged 16 or older and could add a younger sibling as a Trusted Connection, as long as they are 13 or older. 

Roblox claims that more than 145 new ‘safety innovations’ have been deployed this year alone, but critics remain sceptical. This latest evolution has users concerned about uploading images of children to a platform powered by AI.

Do you think Roblox is doing enough to protect children? Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Battlefield 6 is getting a free trial

item.title: Huke Clip Has Fans Predicting an OpTic Texas Three-Peat
item.content:encoded:
The recent Flank Invitational has been perfect for allowing fans of the Call of Duty League a glimpse at how pro players are getting to grips with Black Ops 7’s movement mechanics. The near-future title boasts wall-hopping, faster pacing, and a more technical theme that allows the movement kings of the COD League to really finesse their opponents.

In a recent clip that surfaced on social media, OpTic Texas’ Cuyler ‘Huke’ Garland was seen dunking on Envoy, Abuzah, and Neptune in a slick 1 v 3 that seemed effortless for the recent world champion.

Can OpTic Texas Make History Again?

OpTic Texas is moving differently in Black Ops 7, despite Shotzzy having early concerns about the game’s aim assist mechanics. This game facilitates slick, fast-paced movement, which fits nicely into the wheelhouse of these players.

Huke, especially, is having a brilliant time, with fans recognizing a callback to the Advanced Warfare and Infinite Warfare era of competitive Call of Duty, otherwise known as the ‘Jetpack’ era.

Here’s a clip that surfaced recently on Reddit showing Huke piecing apart a more than capable trio during The Flank’s Black Ops 7 Invitational tournament:

Months ago, Huke was a pivotal part of OpTic Texas securing back-to-back world championship titles, and even more recently, he was part of the squad that secured the top spot at the Esports World Cup in Riyadh.

Going into the CDL 2026 season, the OpTic Texas roster is looking white hot, and there are high expectations for the team in the coming months. Could this be a third consecutive COD League Championship for the organization?

Let me know what you think OpTic Texas’ chances are for a three-peat next season on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Lqgend has joined Vancouver Surge

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#892)—Clues and Answers for Wednesday, November 19
item.content:encoded:
Midweek madness is here, and hopefully, your streak is persisting through it. The festive season is fast approaching, and you’ve got a lot more to focus on, I understand, but getting these NYT Connections hints and solutions down is important right now! With that being said, I’ve got the answers you need for today’s puzzle.

If you’re stumped, read on, as I’ve got the instant NYT Connections solutions for you.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (November 19)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #892:

  • SQUAT
  • SHEPHERD
  • PIT
  • FALL
  • LUNGE
  • LEAD
  • SKINK
  • SOLID
  • HUSKY
  • CASK
  • DIRECT
  • COLONY
  • GUIDE
  • THINK
  • MASQUE
  • HEARTH

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – All straightforward descriptors for a compact, sturdy build.
  • Green – Clear verbs meaning “to show the way” or “influence direction.”
  • Blue – “The Cask of Amontillado,” “The Fall of the House of Usher,” “The Masque of the Red Death,” “The Pit and the Pendulum.”
  • Purple – Each is a valid word formed from a body organ plus a single trailing letter.

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 19.

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 19 (#892)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – HUSKY, SOLID, SQUAT, THICK
  • Green – DIRECT, GUIDE, LEAD, SHEPHERD
  • Blue – CASK, FALL, MASQUE, PIT
  • Purple – COLONY, HEARTH, LUNGE, SKINK

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

item.title: Battlefield 6 is Going Free to Play From November 25 for One Week
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6, the latest ambitious shooter in the legendary first-person franchise, is preparing to go free-to-play for a week, starting November 25. In a recent blog post, Electronic Arts (and associated studios) revealed the free trial period that’s opening up for Battlefield 6, which will likely be accompanied by a considerable discount on the game as Black Friday surfaces.

This limited-time, restricted-scope offering will allow players to experience a fair chunk of Battlefield 6 without investing a penny in the game.

Battlefield 6 Free Trial Coming Soon

In a blog post on the EA website, the Battlefield 6 free trial period was revealed by the team. It was promised that ‘more information’ will be published soon, but for now, we have a description of what the free trial entails:

From November 25 to December 2, ultimate all-out warfare is free** for everyone. Fight in intense urban combat on the streets of Cairo. Drop into iconic SoCal landscapes turned into battlegrounds on Eastwood and Blackwell Fields. Enter Battlefield’s iconic massive scale warfare in Conquest or Breakthrough. Go head-to-head destroying enemy cargo in Sabotage. Engage in pure high-intensity close-quarters combat in Team Deathmatch. This is your call to squad up. Make it count.

This free trial showcases Battlefield 6’s new mode, Sabotage, which was released in the latest update just days ago. Typically, first-person shooters like Call of Duty and anything else in that vein offer free trial weekends, so an entire week for Battlefield 6’s free trial window is obviously above and beyond.

It’s widely assumed that the progress you rack up during the free trial week will roll over into the full game, should you choose to upgrade at any point. In a week, you can grind the living daylights out of the game and unlock stacks of content, so you might be persuaded if a good enough sale goes live to accompany the trial.

In our Battlefield 6 review, we said:

There’s plenty of juice in the tank where the multiplayer platform is concerned, and Electronic Arts’ studios will keep it plugged full of content for a while.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you plan on playing Battlefield 6 during the free trial week.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Tomb Raider has been released on Switch 12 years later

item.title: The Game Awards Removes Nomination for the First Time Ever
item.content:encoded:
For the first time ever, a nomination has been revoked from The Game Awards. The game in question, Megabonk, was disqualified with permission from the creator after a misunderstanding. 

Since 2014, The Game Awards have become a big celebration for the best of gaming each year. Hosted by Geoff Keighley, it’s become home to several big reveals and moments, especially for Game of the Year. With a year as big as 2025 was for games, the competition is sure to be worthy of watching. Nominations for the awards came out earlier this week and had some snubs and surprises. However, it seems there’s already been a shakeup with one of the nominated games.

Megabonk Disqualified from Best Debut Game at The Game Awards 2025

The situation unraveled after The Game Awards nominations earlier this week. Megabonk, one of the games’ up for Best Debut Indie Game, was a pretty popular title when it released. However, the creator, who, in the Tweets, goes by John Megabonk, asked to be removed from the nominations. As for why, he said the following:

“I’m withdrawing from The Game Awards. It’s an honor and a dream for Megabonk to be nominated for TGA, but unfortunately i don’t think it qualifies for the category ‘Debut Indie Game,’” the creator said. “I’ve made games in the past under different studio names, so Megabonk is not my debut game.“

The category, Best Debut Indie Game, is reserved for those who’ve published their first-ever game as a studio, so those who have, even under a different name, shouldn’t count. Geoff Keighley later posted on Twitter that, after the creator’s comments, that Megabonk would be taken off the list. This now leaves Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, Blue Prince, Despolete, and Dispatch as the sole nominees. While it is shocking to see, at least the creator was honest about the situation. Unfortunately, Megabonk was only nominated for the one category so, while they won’t be going home with anything this year, at least it was on a good note.

What do you think of Megabonk being disqualified from The Game Awards? Do you agree with the withdrawal? Did you think it could’ve won the category? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more on The Game Awards, check out Clair Obscur’s record-breaking feat and Xbox’s unfortunate streak. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
